item.title: Ticket #619 (Backporting more Kubrick 1.2.6 fixes) updated
item.dc:creator: bcrow
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #619 (Backporting more Kubrick 1.2.6 fixes) created
item.dc:creator: bcrow
item.description: Backported all fixes from Kubrick 1.2.6 back to the Ryan's 1.2.5 port that's in CVS. Took special care to use new conventions like wp_specialchars where applicable. Also changed two instances of "name=" into "id=" for XHTML strict compliance. This patch continues the work of #609, which updated the CSS file only. This bug has two enclosed patches. The first will update the Kubrick stored in CVS to be completely synched with Michael's latest version (1.2.6) in all ways except the comments. I chose not to backport Michael's changes in wp-comments since they make extensive use of JavaScript with dubious levels of accessibility. The second patch does everything the first does, with the addition of including Michael's changes in the comments (including all its JavaScript).

item.title: Ticket #618 (install link fails if called from wp-admin/install.php) updated
item.dc:creator: skippy
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #618 (install link fails if called from wp-admin/install.php) created
item.dc:creator: skippy
item.description: Fresh install of WordPress into docroot of the domain. I went to ​http://dom.ain/wp-admin/ and was asked to click the link to install.php. This link points to ​http://dom.ain/wp-admin/wp-admin/install.php.

item.title: Ticket #583 (2004-12-21 Dashboard is broken) updated
item.dc:creator: EvilBeAr
item.description:
Reminder sent to rboren

Thanks for your help on this issue. It was a plugin conflict unrelated to the wordpress quote. There is a conflict with the Amazon Wishlist Plugin and the Dashboard. This bug can be closed now. Its not really a bug :)

Thanks again,

Ryan

item.title: Ticket #617 (Exerpt part of advanced editing does not work correctly.) updated
item.dc:creator: Cordman
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #617 (Exerpt part of advanced editing does not work correctly.) created
item.dc:creator: Cordman
item.description: Using the latest (1.5-beta-1 2005-01-02)and when I write a new post using the Advanced Editing feature, the text that is put into the excerpt field is not displayed on the main website page. Only the Title and the Post part are displayed, which is wrong. It should display the Title and the excerpt and provide a link to view more, if I'm not mistaken.

item.title: Ticket #616 (Texturize produces wrong punctuation under certain conditions) updated
item.dc:creator: Adam_M
item.description:
For an example, see this post on my test blog:

​http://adammessinger.com/beta/2005/01/02/texturize-testing/

I've changed the post font to Georgia to make the problem more visible.

item.title: Ticket #616 (Texturize produces wrong punctuation under certain conditions) updated
item.dc:creator: Adam_M
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #616 (Texturize produces wrong punctuation under certain conditions) created
item.dc:creator: Adam_M
item.description: According to the rules of English grammar, when a quotation at the end of a sentence is not itself an exclamation, but the sentence in which itâs quoted is, the exclamation mark goes outside of the closing quotation mark. Texturize fails when the last word of such a quotation is part of a hyperlink.

item.title: Ticket #613 (Cannot Delete Mass Comments) updated
item.dc:creator: Adam_M
item.description: I had this same problem. I ended up upgrading to 1.5 after a big spam attack because I was sick of deleting comments one at a time.

item.title: Ticket #473 (Pings for future-dated posts should be sent at specified future date/time) updated
item.dc:creator: Adam_M
item.description: This should be filed under the XML-RPC category instead of General. Sorry about that.

item.title: Ticket #615 (Inconsistency in XFN creator UI) updated
item.dc:creator: Adam_M
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #615 (Inconsistency in XFN creator UI) created
item.dc:creator: Adam_M
item.description:
In the Add Link interface, the "Identity" option for the XFN creator appears at the bottom, and the label for the check-box reads "me."

In the Edit Link interface, the "Identity" option appears at the top, and the label for the check-box reads "another web address of mine."

item.title: Ticket #614 (Cannot re-assign ownership of links) updated
item.dc:creator: Adam_M
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #614 (Cannot re-assign ownership of links) created
item.dc:creator: Adam_M
item.description: In version 1.5 alpha 6, I can't re-assign ownership of links to another user from the link management interface. Attempting to do so produces no result. I have tried this with several different link categories and produced the same result. Checking in phpMyAdmin confirms that ownership was not changed.
